title: Pipeline Interconnect & Gas Supply Corridor Engineering
description: Defines the engineering basis for pipeline interconnection and gas supply routing, including corridor selection, pressure requirements, flow capacity, regulatory constraints, and integration with upstream supply and downstream regasification systems. Incorporates NPMS, DOT, NFPA 59A, and ISO-NE interconnect rules.
assignments: Technical Brief (1â€“2 pages summarizing assumptions, methodology, decisions)
Executive Summary Slide (1 slide, DOE/FERC/Planning Board ready)
Dependency Map (inputs required, outputs produced, upstream/downstream modules)
Risk Notes (technical, financial, regulatory, schedule risks)
Open Questions Log (items requiring supervisor review)
deliverables: Version-Controlled Working File (Excel, GIS, CAD, RGL/Shiny, or simulation file)
GIS Folder (parcel maps, routing, hazard zones)
CAD/Drawings Folder (layouts, PFDs, P&IDs, block diagrams)
Financial Model Folder (CapEx, O&M, dispatch, tariff models)
Regulatory Library (NFPA 59A, FERC, DOE NEPA, zoning codes)
EPC Vendor Specs (vaporizer, compressor, HRSG, GT, BOP)
Public Data Sources (NOAA, USGS, DOT, grid operators)
